actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act and chapter 21 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to make it clear that service performed by a United States citizen outside the United States on a vessel owned by a foreign subsidiary of a domestic corporation constitutes covered employment for social security purposes if such service is performed under a coverage agreement entered into with such corporation as authorized by section 3121(1) of such Code, and that FICA contributions may be withheld from the remuneration paid for such services.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code to specify that service performed by a U.S. citizen outside the United States on a vessel owned by a foreign subsidiary of a domestic corporation constitutes covered employment for social security purposes if such service is performed under an authorized coverage agreement entered into with such corporation.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act and chapter 21 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to make it clear that service performed by a United States citizen outside the United States on a vessel owned by a foreign subsidiary of a domestic corporation constitutes covered employment for social security purposes if such service is performed under a coverage agreement entered into with such corporation as authorized by section 3121(1) of such Code, and that FICA contributions may be withheld from the remuneration paid for such services.
